hook.text: Your favorite chocolate bar didn't get more expensive. It got smallerâ€”you just didn't notice.

buildup.text: Shrinkflation keeps the price constant while reducing quantity. It exploits inattention.

discovery.text: Consumers are far more sensitive to price increases than to quantity decreases.

twist.text: When exposed, shrinkflation triggers outrage far greater than a simple price increase would.

climax.text: The short-term savings from shrinkflation can become long-term trust destruction.

punchline.text: Hidden tricks work until they're discovered.

quiz.question: Why do companies use shrinkflation instead of raising prices?
options: Consumers notice price increases more than quantity decreases
Regulations prevent price increases in most markets
